node.title: David Attenborough issues hopeful message at COP26, says humans are 'powerful enough to save' the planet
node.alt: Old man in dark suit speaks in front of lectern.
node.description: Sir David AttenboroughÂ tells world leaders he has witnessed a "terrible decline" during his lifetime, but the 95-year-old is confident that humans, "the greatest problem solvers to have ever existed on Earth", can oversee a "wonderful recovery".
node.content:
["British naturalist and documentary maker\u00a0Sir David Attenborough has issued a rallying cry to\u00a0leaders at the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Glasgow, saying the world was looking to them to oversee the recovery of the planet.", "Sir David, who was\u00a0a 'people's advocate' to the COP26 conference, said he had witnessed \"a terrible decline\" during his 95 years of life,\u00a0but was confident that the next generation could and should\u00a0see \"a wonderful recovery\".", "\"Our burning of fossil fuels, our destruction of nature, our approach to industry, construction and learning, are releasing carbon into the atmosphere at an unprecedented pace and scale,\" he told the conference.", "\"We are already in trouble.\"", "He called on the world leaders to step\u00a0up.", "\"It's easy to forget that ultimately the climate emergency comes down to a single number \u2014 the concentration of carbon in our atmosphere,\" Sir David said.", "\"The people alive now are the generation to come, [and] will look at this conference and consider one thing: Did that number stop rising and start to drop as a result of commitments made here?", "\"There's every reason to believe that the answer can be yes.\"", "Sir David also raised the issue of inequality, saying people in developing countries \"who've done the least to cause this problem are being the hardest hit\".", "He said cooperation would be needed to tackle the issue.", "\"We are, after all, the greatest problem solvers to have ever existed on Earth,\" he said.", "\"If working apart, we are a force powerful enough to destabilise our planet. Surely working together, we are powerful enough to save it.\"", "", "
What is COP26 and why should we care?
"]
